summary: Anomaly detection is a fundamentally hard topic in machine learning, especially if we take the view that examples of anomalies are not available at model training time. In this talk we will first explore what we mean by anomaly detection, and the different forms anomaly detection can take (as well as the relationship with other similar topics, e.g. novelty detection and outlier detection). We will then survey the machine leanring app[roaches that can be used for anomaly detection and when the are most effective.
title: That's Funny: Machine Learning for Anomaly Detection
An open-data-driven agent-based model to simulate infectious disease outbreaks (vol 13, e0208775, 2018)
Correction: An open-data-driven agent-based model to simulate infectious disease outbreaks
Kalman Filter-based Heuristic Ensemble (KFHE): A New Perspective on Multi-class Ensemble Classification Using Kalman Filters

summary: A short presentation given as part of a roundtable session at the Tallinn digital Summit 2018. This presentation asked questions about how we will respond to Ireland's AI needs so as to ensure our population is educated both to create and use AI.
title: Educating for Ireland's Future AI Needs

summary: Deep learning techniques have been really effective for text and image datasets, achieving amazing performance on benchmark problems. In this talk we examine some other application areas in which deep learning methods have been shown to  work very well and discuss how techniques developed with text and images in mind need to  be adapted to work with other types of data.
title: Applications of Deep Learning (Beyond Text & Images)
A Comparison of Agent-Based Models and Equation Based Models for Infectious Disease Epidemiology

Deep learning at the shallow end: Malware classification for non-domain experts

ROGER: An On-Line Flight Efficiency Monitoring System using ADS-B Data
Radial Basis Function Data Descriptor (RBFDD) Network: An Anomaly Detection Approach
Scoped: Evaluating A Composite Visualisation of the Scope Chain Hierarchy Within Source Code
Stability of topic modeling via matrix factorization
The Code Mini-Map Visualisation: Encoding Conceptual Structures Within Source Code
Using a Socioeconomic Segregation Burn-in Model to Initialise an Agent-Based Model for Infectious Diseases.

summary: A huge amount of our daily activities now create a digital footprint - every phone call or SMS; every Facebook like or Tweet; every email; every online purchase; every Wi-Fi network joined or every work-out session recorded. All of these little digital footprints combine together to create a detailed picture of us that can be mined to determine our preferences, opinions, and desires. Whether we call it data science, machine learning, data mining, or big data, corporations and government organisations are using technologies to mine these digital footprints for insights to make predictions about the future behaviours of their customers and citizens. This interactive seminar will guide audiences on an exploration of the current state of the art data-driven prediction technology, its applications and likely consequences (good and bad).
title: Show me your data, and I'll tell you who you are: an exploration of data-driven prediction

summary: In this talk Brian explores the origins of AI from humble beginnings in the 1950s to today's proliferation of AI technologies. Brian lifts the curtain on modern AI techniques, particularly machine learning, to show that they are not magic but rather an evolution of techniques that have reached exciti9ng new lkevels of performance.
title: AI 101: Everything You Wish You Knew About Artificial Intelligence But Were Too Afraid To Ask!
